effect:

- On the turn played, the owning player may play any or all of the cards in his hand, ignoring the three card limit (but not other limits).
- This card may not be played during turn 1 or 2 of a game.
- Discarded after use.

name: Advanced Preparedness
effect:
- Allows any one card to be played in reaction mode.
- The card played may only perform functions which do not require any points.
- Discarded after use.

name: Akru Supernova
effect: - Causes 3 damage to each of 10 ships, bases or terrain in one fleet.

name: Alien Abduction
effect:
- Causes one opponent crew card of equal or lesser strength to be discarded along with this card.
- A reaction mode transporter, shuttle or fighter will save the crew card, causing only the abduction card to be discarded.

name: Alien Artifact
effect:
A rare alien artifact with wondrous powers is discovered.
- When this card is played to the discard pile, the owning player draws three cards from his deck.

name: Alien Love Interest
effect:
- Affects one crew card of equal or lesser strength.
- Crew card provides no benefits.
- Crew card may only take actions if approved by owner of this card.
- Negated by research points equal to its strength.

name: Alien Parasites
effect:
- Infests a ship's crew, causing the ship to be disengaged.
- Discarded after research points equal to its strength have been applied.

name: Alliance Treaty
effect:
You have just signed an alliance treaty with an outside force. Do one of the following:
- Immediately draw 5 cards.
- Play this card on an opponent, preventing him from firing weapons at your fleet for 2 turns unless you fire on him first.

- Discarded after use.

  • Number: 300
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: O
  • Strength: 9
  • Artist: Melissa Benson
- Discarded after use.

name: Ambassador
effect:
- Only ships and bases with a strength higher than the strength of the ambassador can fire on his current location.
- Any unit may fire on a ship or base with an ambassador if the ambassador's ship or base is the only one in play in the fleet.

name: Ancient Molting
effect:
Space dragons molt once every 1000 years, shedding their scales for a new, tougher set.

- Adds 5 points of strength to a D dragon.
- More than one molting card may be played on a space dragon.

  • Number: 8
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: A
  • Strength: 5
  • Artist: Paul 'Prof' Herbert

- Adds 5 points of strength to a D dragon.
- More than one molting card may be played on a space dragon.

name: Ancient Spacefarer
effect:
This ancient wanderer joins the crew of a ship and provides the following benefits:
- All negative luck cards played to his location are negated.
- Must be played to a location with a crew card.

name: Anomaly Portal
effect:
- Diverts any card just played on your fleet onto the opponent of your choice (cannot be diverted to original card owner unless he is the last opponent remaining).
- Discarded after use.

name: Argonian Strobe
effect:
The Argonian strobe blinds the fire control scanners of up to 3 bases or ships belonging to any one opponent for one turn.
- Affected units may not fire weapons during their next turn.
- The defending player chooses which three units are affected.
- Cannot be used on the same opponent on two consecutive turns.
- Foreign technology to all but Argonians.

name: Armory Moon
effect:
Generated Points: ⚫■■

Most empires found it necessary to have munitions stores at several locations in each sector. An armory provides needed supplies and ammunition. Generally, uninhabited moons were used for these munitions depositories.

  • Number: 399
  • Rarity: C2
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 3
  • Artist: Douglas Shuler

Most empires found it necessary to have munitions stores at several locations in each sector. An armory provides needed supplies and ammunition. Generally, uninhabited moons were used for these munitions depositories.

name: Assassin
effect:
An assassin requires a transporter, fighter or shuttlecraft to do one of the following per turn:
- Assassinate a crew card (discarding it) of equal or lesser strength.
- May use his spy-like abilities to look at one card in the hand of one opponent on turns when no assassination is performed.

name: Asteroid Belt - Benakis Asteroid Belt
effect:
Generated Points: ⚫✸✸

The Benakis Belt is a thick band of asteroids orbiting the red dwarf Bena. Bena has no other satellites. The Benakis Belt is mostly worthless rock and ice, but its prime location in the Free Trade Zone makes it useful for many traders, merchants and pirates. The empires also found it a useful system to occupy on occasion.

effect:

name: Breakdown [O5]

name: Helmsman
effect:
- Each damage-causing hazard card played against a ship with a helmsman causes one less point of damage than usual each turn.
- As a card play, the helmsman's ship and all accompanying cards (except the helmsman) may be returned to your hand; the helmsman is discarded.

name: Hot Nobelium
effect:
Hot nobelium is a rare element found floating in space. Dragons which have eaten hot nobelium have stronger breath weapons.
- Each breath weapon point causes 2 points of damage.
- Card remains in play on dragon until the dragon is destroyed.

name: Huge Phaser Eel
effect:
Phaser eels are monsters made of kinetic phaser energy.
- The phaser eel absorbs all phaser fire from the base or ship on which it is played before that fire can damage other units.
- The phaser eel can only be damaged by non-phaser weapons. Nine points of damage are needed to kill a huge phaser eel.
- Research has no effect on phaser eels.

name: Hull Rotation - Argonian Hull Rotation
effect:
Only Argonian ships can perform hull rotations. Generic units may not perform hull rotations.
- Ignore damage points from a volley equal to the current strength of the ship's shields.
- Discarded after one use.
- Exclusive Argonian technology.

effect:
- This card allows an engaged ship to fire its phasers during an opponent's fire phase.

- Discarded after use.

name: Mutineer
effect:
- A mutineer seizes control of an opponent ship or base, disengaging it.
- The mutineer is discarded when the total strength of the opponent's crew played on that ship or base equals or exceeds the strength of the mutineer.
- A ship or base under the effect of a mutineer cannot self-destruct.

name: Mystic Wanderer
effect:
This bizarre entity causes all types of beings to flock to him under the effect of some kind of trance.
- Must be played on a terrain card.
- Each opponent turn, the opponent must move a crew card from his fleet to the terrain card where the mystic wanderer is located. That crew card will not function while there.
- Crew remains at location until wanderer is eliminated. Crew may then be transported back by standard rules.

name: Natural Disaster
effect:
- Causes all economy on a terrain card to be consumed for two turns including economy points from modifier cards.
- Discarded after use.

name: Navigational Error
effect:

- Player owning the ship chooses which terrain card is hit, except when the ship is in play on a terrain card.
- May only be played on ships of equal or lesser strength.
- Discarded after use.

name: Navigator

name: Visilikiiy's Eye
effect:
Visilikiiy's Eye is a large eye-shaped creature of near planetary proportions. It possesses omniscient powers. Allows the owning player to do one of the following each turn:
- Look at one card in one opponent's hand.
- Look at the card on top of an opponent's deck.
- Look at an opponent's entire hand. The eye is discarded with this use.

name: Void Dragoness
effect:
The void dragon resides within an antimatter cloud (a void).
- When engaged, allows the owning player to use a hazard card (up to the current strength of the dragon) twice on the turn it is played as if two such cards were played.

name: Volatile Cargo
effect:
Some cargo is highly explosive.
- The opponent unit or other card which causes the last point of damage, destroying the ship or base on which this card is played, suffers damage equal to 1/2 (drop fractions) of the strength of the ship or base.
- This card does not absorb damage points.

name: Wandering Desire [O3]
effect:
- Causes the Indirigan ship on which it is played (and all accompanying cards) to be discarded.
- If the Indirigans are the major fleet in that deck, stack is placed back into the owner's hand instead of being discarded.
- Cannot be played on Indirigan ships with a crew card of strength 4 or greater.
- Strengths of multiple wandering desire cards can be combined vs ships with stronger crew.
- Discarded after use.

name: Wandering Desire [O5]
effect:
- Causes the Indirigan ship on which it is played (and all accompanying cards) to be discarded.
- If the Indirigans are the major fleet in that deck, stack is placed back into the owner's hand instead of being discarded.
- Cannot be played on Indirigan ships with a crew card of strength 6 or greater.
- Strengths of multiple wandering desire cards can be combined vs ships with stronger crew.
- Discarded after use.

name: Warp Engine Breech
effect:
An engine breech causes an internal explosion.
- Ship takes damage equal to 1/2 its maximum strength.
- This damage may not be applied against the shields.
- Discarded after use.

name: Warp Field Destabilization Gun
effect:
- May be fired at one ship or base each turn. May not be fired at the same unit two turns in a row.
- The target requires 3 times its normal energy requirement on its next turn.
- Foreign technology to all but the Corporation.

name: Warp Funnel
effect:
This phenomenon appears suddenly, accelerating a ship in a random direction.
- Causes 1 point of damage per turn.
- Prevents a ship from protecting its Sector HQ.
- Four points of weapons damage is required to eliminate a warp funnel.

name: Weapons Officer
effect:
Illustration: A Bolaar Weapons Officer.
A weapons officer provides the following benefits to his location:
- Every 2 weapons fired do 3 points of damage.
- Ignores the negative effects of electronic warfare cards.

name: Zarom
effect:
Zarom are jet-like boring creatures which eat in swarms. Zarom eat space monsters and dragons.

- Causes one point of damage per turn to all monsters and dragons controlled by the fleet on which this card is played.
- Destroyed by research points equal to its strength.
